story_1: With a speed like a supercharged race car and a unique zig-zaggy path, Zoomy darts through space, leaving stardust behind!
story_2: Zoomy blasts through space at an incredible speed—about 157,800 km/h! 🌪️ That's fast enough to zoom around the Earth 4 times in just one hour! Every year, Zoomy travels a whopping 876 million kilometers—more than 22,000 trips around the planet! 🌍
story_3: Zoomy isn't a perfect snowball in the sky—it's more like a stretched-out pancake! With its long, skinny shape, Zoomy stretches out when it gets far from the Sun and swoops in close when it returns. Its eccentric orbit gives it that cool, elliptical look!
story_4: 🔭 But scientists call it... Halley's Comet!
story_5: That's right! Zoomy's real name is 1P/Halley, but we think 'Zoomy' suits it perfectly, don't you? 🌈💫
